subject: Clarification on Applicability of GST on Hybrid Annuity Projects; which are in bidding stage for uniformity-reg.
text: HTrv 7cftq TTTHTf wfaarrut TMt Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (3m 5av7t &r TiAri #TT) QAA/Fax 81-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India QA Exin , 2223 2318 2468 2553 (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 4-5Ta 6, 7337-10, &Trt, 7$ fvht 110 075 6-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 NHAIFEAIGST-2017-18/SM Dated 29th Sept. 2017 CIRCULAR (3.3.14 Subject: Clarification on Applicability of GST on Hybrid Annuity Projects, which are in bidding stage for uniformity- reg: n order to maintain uniformity in bid pricing by the prospective bidders, the following clarifications are issued on applicability of GST on HAM Projects: Bid Project Cost: Shall be the all-inclusive cost as defined in cl. No 23.1 exclusive of GST applicable on the Annuities payments. 1. Payment of Bid Project Cost: NHAI pays 40% of the bid project cost as defined in cl 23.3.1 to the Concessionaire_in five equal installments of [8% (eight percent)] each during construction period. GST shall be applicable with 100% Input Tax Credit (ITC) o such portion of the value of work done. Hence , the impact f GST to this extent shall be considered by the Bidders to built-in their quotes. 1. Annuity Payments during Operation Period: For completion cost remaining to be paid on COD through Annuities (Ci ,23.6.3), GST shall be applicable at the time of Annuities Payments at the applicable GST rate and it shall be paid by NHAI to the Concessionaire separately at the time of making Annuity payment. It may be assumed that no Input Tax Credit (ITC) will be availed by the Concessionaire. However , if any Input Tax Credit (ITC) is availed by the Concessionaire, the benefit of such ITC shall be passed on to NHAI. As GST shall be paid by NHAI in addition to the Annuities (as applicable), the GST portion shall not be included in Bid Project Cost quoted by the Bidders. IV. GST shall be payable on Bonus for early completion as per cl. 23.5 at the then applicable GST rate without any Input Tax Credit and NHAI shall pay such GST . However = if any input tax credit is availed by the Concessionaire, the benefit of such ITC shall be passed on to NHAI. First Year O&M as per cl.23.7 shall be_inclusive of GST at the applicable rate on works contract with 100% Input Tax Credit (ITC). This circular is issued for the guidance of prospective bidders, in order to adopt & uniform bid pricing at the time of submission of bids, as far as GST implications are concerned_ This is issued with the approval of Competent Authority: Sibanarayan Nayak CGM (FA) to: (i) Al NHAI HQJROs/PIUs (ii) PS to Chairman (iii)PS to all Members (iv) Web Admin for hosting on GST Portal (v) Library Copy
